elements.title: Saint John's Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Saint John's Island was the site of one of the British Empire's largest quarantine centres (pictured) and held one of the first experimental drug rehabilitation centres?

elements.title: wildlife of Sudan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the wildlife of Sudan includes leopards, giraffes, crocodiles, water hyacinth and the umbrella thorn acacia?

elements.title: Nagaoka Nobuko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Japanese pianist Nagaoka Nobuko, a child prodigy called an "absolute genius", was killed in the final American firebombing of Tokyo?

elements.title: Yamaha Reface (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a robotic controller for the Yamaha Reface CS was described by Mixmag magazine as looking "like an army of robot toothbrushes cleaning a synth"?

elements.title: West Auckland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that West Auckland is home to the largest stratovolcano in the geologic history of New Zealand?

elements.title: al-Battani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that al-Battani was one the first astronomers to observe that the distance between the Earth and the Sun varies during the year?

elements.title: The Embrace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Embrace, a monument to Martin Luther King Jr. and Coretta Scott King, was deemed phallic?

elements.title: Ashley Leechin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Taylor Swift-lookalike Ashley Leechin went viral for doing laundry?
